title: Black Belt Jones
descriptions:
"Black Belt Jones" is a 1974 martial arts film starring Jim Kelly as the titular character. Jim Kelly plays Black Belt Jones, a skilled martial artist who works as a maintenance man in a large apartment complex. 

Jones is a quiet and unassuming man who keeps to himself. However, when the complex is threatened by a crime syndicate, he reveals his true identity as a skilled martial artist. Jones uses his skills to take down the gang and protect the complex's residents.

The film features a mix of martial arts action and comedy, with Jones using his wit and agility to outsmart his opponents. The movie also stars Glynn Turman as a local journalist who helps Jones in his quest to take down the crime syndicate.

"Black Belt Jones" is notable for being one of the few films to feature a predominantly African American cast and crew, including the film's director, Robert Clouse. The movie has since become a cult classic and is still widely enjoyed by fans of 1970s martial arts cinema. Despite its flaws, the film remains a fun and entertaining watch, with Jim Kelly's charismatic performance being a highlight of the movie.
